result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph B. Beard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph B. Beard is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph B. Beard was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

records.addlTxt: per Sam @ ONSO - detainer - Vilas County

2:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph B. Beard not in court, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Joseph B. Beard. Calling 22CF31, 22CF2, 21CT5, 22TR3, 22TR4, 22TR5, & 22TR19. Svehlek has no information to Defendant's non-appearance. Schiek request warrant be authorized. Court authorizes warrant. Traffic cases will be defaulted. adj. 02:46 PM
Must follow through with wellness treatment court

11:16 a.m. Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph B. Beard appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Joseph B. Beard. Calling 22CF2, 22CF31,21CT95,22TR4, 22TR5, 22TR19, 22TR3. Svehlek requests bond modification in order to allow to defendant to participate in wellness court. Sowinski no objection. Court grants bond reduction - modifies cash bond to $5,000 signature bond in both 22CF2 and 22CF31 w/condition that he follow through with treatment court. Adj. 11:19 a.m.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:23 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Joseph B. Beard appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Joseph B. Beard. Calling 22CF31, 22CF2, 21CT95 22TR19 & 22TR3 - 22TR5. 22CF31 set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Svehlek willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Defendant would like no contact dropped. Court advises to contact attorney. Bond continued. adj.  02:36 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 11:15 am.

3:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Joseph B. Beard appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Joseph B. Beard. Calling 22CF2, 21CT95 , 22TR19 & 22TR3 - 22TR5. Court to set out. Bond continued. adj. 03:36 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
1:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Joseph B. Beard appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek appearing by video. Calling 22CF2, 21CT95 & 22TR3 - 22TR5. 21CT95 set for an initial appearance. 22CF2 set for an adjourned initial appearance. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - waives preliminary hearing.  Schiek states charges will mirror complaint. Svehlek will proceed to arraignement - waive reading - not guilty pleas in both cases. Court modifies bond in 21CT95 to a $500 cash bond and sets bond bond in 21CT95 adj. 01:33 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Court states Defendant is eligible for PD. Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek appearing by video does not have copy of complaint - would like set for adjourned initial appearance. Defendant in receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek/Svehlek statement to bail. Court set cash bond over weekend - continued.  adj. 01:40 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
